data.title: Shirin Ebadi – Interview
data.meta_description: The Nobel Peace Prize 2003 was awarded to Shirin Ebadi "for her efforts for democracy and human rights. She has focused especially on the struggle for the rights of women and children"
data.text:
Shirin Ebadi

Interview

Interview, November 2010

Your browser does not support the video tag.

Shirin Ebadi, 2003 Nobel Peace Prize Laureate, visited Stockholm 22 November 2010. She is in exile in the United Kingdom since June 2009, but she never ceases her work for human rights in Iran.

To cite this section

MLA style: Shirin Ebadi – Interview. NobelPrize.org. Nobel Prize Outreach AB 2024. Wed. 24 Jul 2024. <https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/peace/2003/ebadi/interview/>
